title: Glitches at Slack, Peloton Prompt Disruptions for Users; Messaging company sees improvement after earlier outage; fitness-equipment maker says it is 'seeing widespread recovery' from prior issue
text:
"We're continuing to see improvements, but we still have some work to do," Slack said.

There were more than 10,000 reports of Slack outages at around 9:30 a.m. ET, according to Downdetector, which tracks website outages. The number of reported outages decreased significantly by early afternoon.

Exercise-bike company Peloton also was having technical issues on Tuesday. The company said in a tweet that it was investigating an issue with its services. About an hour later, the company said on its website that it was "seeing widespread recovery" of its services. Downdetector showed 5,490 reports of the service being down as of 10:38 a.m. but reports dropped shortly afterward.

Temporary interruptions for popular social-media sites, websites and messaging platforms are relatively common. Some of the outages have been felt more widespread as many employees turn to cloud services and other connected platforms to help them work remotely during the pandemic.

Salesforce.com Inc. said in late 2020 that it agreed to purchase Slack in a $27.7 billion deal. The deal closed in July 2021.
